page.title: 06CHURCHES IN OTLEY
page.content: The first Norman church which was built on the foundations of the earliest Saxon structures in the twelfth century or early eleventh century,is now the chapel which is extended westwards. The foundations of a west wall being exposed during restoration work during 1887. The Parish church has had many changes. It has eight bells overall. It has had fiftyone vicars so far. The vicars did not have very long lives. The longest standing vicar was twelve years. There are eight pieces of the church, which were re-arranged in different centuries.
